question: Agreeing to the Fiscal autonomy to India, in which of the following years, the British Government established an Indian Fiscal Commission in the pre-independence Era?
explanation: Indian Fiscal Commission was constituted in the year 1919 and as per its recommendation, tariff Protection should be launched for certain Indian Industries. As a follow up to the recommendations to this commission, a tariff board was established in 1923 and in 1924, the Steel Industry of India was given protection.
